page.title: 10St.Andrew,Stoke Dry.
page.content: The focal point of the village is St. Andrew's Church,which dates from Norman times.There are many interest- ing architectural features of Gothic styles,since the church was largely rebuilt in this period.Recently,medi- eval wall paintings were discovered & restored as much as possible using sand,lime and original basic colours. Over the Tudor North Porch is a Priest's room where,it is suggested, that the Gunpowder Plot was hatched in 1604/05,as Sir Everard Digby,who was hanged for treason in 1606,occupied the Manor at this time.In the small churchyard are examples of holly,yew, ash,beech,sycamore & elder trees.Many of the old tombstones are of limestone There is no electricity in the church and evening services are by candle- light.The organ is pumped by hand and there is one bell.
